com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Interface TransformableSelection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MutableSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectionTool, AbstractTransformTool, LassoTool, PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RotateTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SelectionTool, SlantTool

    public interface TransformableSelection
extends MutableSelection
    Defines a series of "static" transforms that can be applied to a selection. A static transform is one that can be applied directly, without user/mouse engagement (e.g., scale, slant, or projection).

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.MutableSelection

    • Method Detail

      • reduceColor

        default void reduceColor(int colorDepth)
        Converts the current selection to a reduced palette containing no more than the specified number of colors. This method uses a naive color quantization algorithm that does not optimize the reduced color palette for the given image; it simply produces a new palette with colors evenly distributed in the color space and maps colors in the selection image to the nearest color in the reduced palette. The number of unique colors in the reduced-color selection will not, necessarily, equal the provided color depth. Note that this method merely adjusts the look of the selection and does not affect the canvas' image storage in any way (all images are always stored in 24-bit "true color" irrespective of whether they have been reduced via this method. Thus, reducing colors will not reduce memory usage or affect how the image is exported or saved.
        Parameters:
        colorDepth - The maximum number of unique colors that should appear in the resultant selection image; zero produces a black and white (monochrome) image. Note that color depth should be cubic; if the cubed root of colorDepth is not an integer, the cube of the the floor of the cubed root will be assumed.

      • reduceGreyscale

        default void reduceGreyscale(int grayDepth)
        Converts the current selection to a gray-scale image containing no more than the specified number of gray shades. See reduceColor(int) for details about palette selection and dithering.
        Parameters:
        grayDepth - The maximum number of unique shades of gray in which to render the given image; zero produces a black and white (monochrome) image.

      • rotateLeft

        default void rotateLeft()
        Rotates the image 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

      • rotateRight

        default void rotateRight()
        Rotates the image 90 degrees clockwise.

      • flipHorizontal

        default void flipHorizontal()
        Flips or mirrors the image along its vertical axis. That is, all pixels on the left side of the image will move the right side and vice versa.

      • flipVertical

        default void flipVertical()
        Flips or mirrors the image along its horizontal axis. That is, all pixels on the top of the image will move to the bottom and vice versa.

      • adjustBrightness

        default void adjustBrightness(int delta)
        Adjusts the brightness of the image by the amount specified in delta while preserving the image's alpha transparency.
        Parameters:
        delta - An amount by which brightness should be adjusted, -256 to +256. Negative numbers darken an image, positive numbers brighten it.

      • adjustTransparency

        default void adjustTransparency(int delta)
        Adjusts the alpha transparency of the image while maintain hue, saturation and brightness.
        Parameters:
        delta - An amount by which transparency should be adjusted -256 to +256; Negative numbers make the image more transparent, positive numbers make the image more opaque.

      • invert

        default void invert()
        Inverts the color of the image while preserving the alpha transparency.

      • applyTransform

        default void applyTransform(AffineTransform transform)
        Applies an AffineTransform the current image.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to apply.
